location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.136 of 1850 from Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter from Hennell forwards to Malet a translation of a letter sent by Khojah Hiskal, the Native Agent at Muscat, dated 25 February 1850, which reports on the murder of Sheikh Syf ben Humood [Saif bin Hamood] of Sohar [Suhar] by his slave servant, at the instigation of Saif's father Syed Humood ben Azan [Said Hamood bin Azan].
